docs.abstract: A defect petition filed with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration gives a consumer unusual clout.
docs.snippet: A defect petition filed with the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration gives a consumer unusual clout.
docs.lead_paragraph: Gary Weinreich was terrified when the steering on his 2005 Toyota 4Runner failed on a busy two-lane highway in South Carolina in May. Later, he was angry enough that he wanted to do more than gripe. So he tried a little-known tactic to compel federal regulators to investigate and possibly recall 500,000 other 4Runners for a prematurely rusted frame.

headline.main: A Little-Known Tactic Can Make the U.S. Investigate Your Car-Safety Problem
headline.print_headline: Car Defect? Here’s How to Get Attention

docs.abstract: Tech companies used to want to be in the news because it often meant fawning coverage for a new device. How times have changed, writes Brian X. Chen.
docs.snippet: Tech companies used to want to be in the news because it often meant fawning coverage for a new device. How times have changed, writes Brian X. Chen.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, technology reporters and columnists from The New York Times review the week’s news, offering analysis and maybe a joke or two about the most important developments in the tech industry. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: Facebook Is in the News. Again.
headline.print_headline: Facebook’s in the News, And No, It’s Not Good

docs.abstract: The chain said it would remove the products from its more than 2,400 locations over the next 90 days. It will continue to sell regular tobacco products.
docs.snippet: The chain said it would remove the products from its more than 2,400 locations over the next 90 days. It will continue to sell regular tobacco products.
docs.lead_paragraph: Rite Aid, one of the country’s biggest pharmacy chains, will stop selling e-cigarettes and vaping products because of concern that they are fueling tobacco use among middle and high school students across the United States.

headline.main: Rite Aid to Stop Selling E-Cigarettes, Citing Surge in Young Users
headline.print_headline: Rite Aid Will Halt Sales of Vaping Products

docs.abstract: A huge fraud at a Malaysian investment fund has weighed on Goldman’s stock. How are prosecutors approaching the case — and how can the firm defend itself?
docs.snippet: A huge fraud at a Malaysian investment fund has weighed on Goldman’s stock. How are prosecutors approaching the case — and how can the firm defend itself?
docs.lead_paragraph: Get the DealBook newsletter to make sense of major business and policy headlines — and the power-brokers who shape them.__________

headline.main: How Much Could the 1MDB Scandal Cost Goldman Sachs?
headline.print_headline: How Much Could a Malaysia Investment Scandal Cost Goldman?

docs.abstract: Prosecutors in Japan charged the company and its former chairman with violating financial laws by underreporting his compensation by tens of millions of dollars.
docs.snippet: Prosecutors in Japan charged the company and its former chairman with violating financial laws by underreporting his compensation by tens of millions of dollars.
docs.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — Prosecutors in Japan on Monday indicted Carlos Ghosn, the former chairman of Nissan Motor, and the auto company itself on charges that they had violated financial laws by underreporting Mr. Ghosn’s compensation.

headline.main: Carlos Ghosn, Ex-Nissan Chief, and Nissan Are Charged With Misstating His Pay
headline.print_headline: Nissan Charged With Ghosn  For Misstating Compensation

byline.original: By Makiko Inoue and Motoko Rich

docs.abstract: Urjit Patel resigned on Monday after the Modi government sought to loosen loan restrictions and spend some of the central bank’s cash reserves.
docs.snippet: Urjit Patel resigned on Monday after the Modi government sought to loosen loan restrictions and spend some of the central bank’s cash reserves.
docs.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI, India — India’s top central banker resigned on Monday after tussling for months with Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s government over its desire to exert more control over the bank’s regulations and tap its reserves to increase government spending.

headline.main: India’s Top Central Banker Quits as Government Seeks More Control
headline.print_headline: Top Indian Banker Quits Over Government Control

docs.abstract: Meng Wanzhou, a Huawei executive who American authorities want to extradite from Canada on fraud charges, was granted bail of 10 million dollars on Tuesday.
docs.snippet: Meng Wanzhou, a Huawei executive who American authorities want to extradite from Canada on fraud charges, was granted bail of 10 million dollars on Tuesday.
docs.lead_paragraph: VANCOUVER, British Columbia — Meng Wanzhou, a top executive of the Chinese technology company Huawei, was granted bail of 10 million Canadian dollars, or about $7.5 million, while awaiting extradition to the United States from Canada, a judge ruled on Tuesday.

headline.main: Huawei Executive Granted Bail by Canadian Court
headline.print_headline: Canada Grants Bail to Huawei Executive Sought by U.S.

docs.abstract: The women had sued Mr. Rose and CBS in May, alleging that they were sexually harassed by the former anchorman and that the network did nothing to stop it.
docs.snippet: The women had sued Mr. Rose and CBS in May, alleging that they were sexually harassed by the former anchorman and that the network did nothing to stop it.
docs.lead_paragraph: CBS News reached a legal settlement with three women who accused the network of not doing enough to stop one of its anchors, Charlie Rose, from sexually harassing them.

headline.main: CBS Settles With Women Who Accused Charlie Rose of Sexual Harassment
headline.print_headline: CBS Settles With Women Who Said Rose Harassed Them

docs.abstract: Ms. Gifford and her co-host, Hoda Kotb, have become fixtures on NBC’s morning lineup over the past decade, along with their ever-present glasses of wine.
docs.snippet: Ms. Gifford and her co-host, Hoda Kotb, have become fixtures on NBC’s morning lineup over the past decade, along with their ever-present glasses of wine.
docs.lead_paragraph: Kathie Lee Gifford, the co-anchor of the popular fourth hour of NBC’s “Today,” tearfully announced to viewers on Tuesday that she would be leaving the morning show in April.

headline.main: Kathie Lee Gifford Says She Will Leave ‘Today’ in April
headline.print_headline: Gifford to Raise Final Glass To ‘Today’ After 11 Years

docs.abstract: There’s no class in, ahem, college, to prepare us for saving for our children’s college education. Let this guide be your starting point.
